intro: Genista mugronensis, commonly known as the Mugron broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by elongated seed pods. Its shrub-like form and hardy nature make it a resilient species in its native habitat.
